1.verse: Prologue -Chapter 1 -The Revelation or Apocalypse of Jesus Christ. -The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God entrusted to him so that he might show his servants what must soon take place. He made it known by sending his angel to his servant John,

2.verse: who has borne witness to the word of God and to the testimony of Jesus Christ by reporting everything that he has seen.

3.verse: Blessed is the one who reads the words of this prophecy, and blessed are those who keep what is written in it, for the appointed time is near.

4.verse: He Is, He Was, and He Will Return. -John, to the seven Churches in Asia: grace to you and peace from him who is, who was, and who is to come, and from the seven spirits before his throne,

5.verse: and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead and the ruler of the kings of the earth. He loves us and has washed away our sins with his blood

6.verse: and made us to be a kingdom and priests to serve his God and Father—to him be glory and power forever and ever. Amen.

7.verse: Behold, he is coming with the clouds;every eye will see him,even those who pierced him.All the peoples of the earth will mourn him.So shall it be. Amen.

8.verse: “I am the Alpha and the Omega,” says the Lord God, “the one who is, and who was, and who is to come, the Almighty.”

9.verse: “I Am the First and the Last.” -I, John—your brother and partner in the suffering and the kingdom and the patient endurance that are ours in Jesus—was on the island of Patmos because I had proclaimed the word of God and given testimony to Jesus.

10.verse: On the Lord’s day, I was caught up in the spirit, and I heard behind me a loud voice, like the sound of a trumpet,

11.verse: that said, “Write down on a scroll what you see and send it to the seven Churches: to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea.

12.verse: Then I turned to see whose voice it was that had spoken to me, and when I turned I beheld seven gold lampstands.

13.verse: And in the midst of the lampstands I saw one like a son of man, dressed in a robe that reached down to his feet and with a golden breastplate around his chest.

14.verse: His head and his hair were white with the whiteness of wool, like snow, and his eyes were like a burning flame.

15.verse: His feet were like burnished bronze refined in a furnace, and his voice was like the sound of rushing waters.

16.verse: In his right hand he held seven stars. From his mouth there protruded a sharp, two-edged sword, and his face shone like the sun in all its brilliance.

17.verse: When I saw him, I fell at his feet as though dead, but he laid his right hand on me and said, “Do not be afraid. I am the First and the Last. I am the Living One.

18.verse: I was dead, but now I am alive forevermore, and I hold the keys to death and the netherworld.

19.verse: “Now write down what you have seen, what is happening now, and what will take place afterward.

20.verse: The mystery of the seven stars that you saw in my right hand, and of the seven gold lampstands, is this: the seven stars are the angels of the seven Churches, and the seven lampstands are the seven Churches themselves.

1.verse: Letters to the Churches -Chapter 2 -To Ephesus. -“To the angel of the Church in Ephesus, write:“ ‘These are the words of the one who holds the seven stars in his right hand and who walks in the midst of the seven lampstands:

2.verse: “ ‘ “I know your deeds, your hard work, and your endurance. I know that you cannot tolerate wicked people, and how you have put to the test those who claim to be apostles but are not, and have found them to be impostors.

3.verse: I am also aware of your perseverance and how you have toiled for my name without becoming weary.

4.verse: “ ‘ “However, I have this complaint against you: you have lost the love you had at first.

5.verse: Remember from where you have fallen. Repent and do as you did originally. Otherwise, unless you repent, I will come to you and remove your lampstand from its place.

6.verse: Nonetheless, this may be said in your favor: you detest the works of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

7.verse: “ ‘ “Whoever has ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the Churches. To anyone who is victorious, I will give the right to eat from the tree of life that is in the paradise of God.” ’

8.verse: To Smyrna. -“To the angel of the Church in Smyrna, write:“ ‘These are the words of the First and the Last, who was dead and came to life again:

9.verse: “ ‘ “I know of your hardships and your poverty, but in reality you are rich. I am aware of the slander of those who claim to be Jews but are actually members of the synagogue of Satan.

10.verse: Do not be frightened when thinking about the sufferings that you will have to endure. The devil will throw some of you into prison so that you may be tested, and you will endure affliction for ten days. Remain faithful until death, and I will give you the crown of life.

11.verse: “ ‘ “Whoever has ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the Churches. Anyone who is victorious will not be harmed by the second death.” ’

12.verse: To Pergamum. -“To the angel of the Church in Pergamum, write:“ ‘These are the words of the one who has the sharp double-edged sword:

13.verse: “ ‘ “I know that you live in the place where Satan is enthroned. Yet you have remained firm in support of my name, and you did not deny your faith in me even at the time when Antipas, my faithful witness, was put to death among you, where Satan lives.

14.verse: “ ‘ “Nevertheless, I have a few things against you. Some of you are holding to the teaching of Balaam, who instructed Balak to place temptations in the path of the Israelites, encouraging them to eat food sacrificed to idols and to engage in fornication.

15.verse: Likewise, there are some of you who follow the teaching of the Nicolaitans.

16.verse: Therefore, repent. If you do not do so, I will come to you quickly and attack them with the sword of my mouth.

17.verse: “ ‘ “Whoever has ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the Churches. To anyone who is victorious I will give some of the hidden manna. I will also give him a white stone, upon which will be inscribed a new name, known only to the person who receives it.” ’

18.verse: To Thyatira. -“To the angel of the Church in Thyatira, write:“ ‘These are the words of the Son of God who has eyes like a burning flame and feet like burnished bronze:

19.verse: “ ‘ “I know your deeds—your love, your faithfulness, your service, and your endurance—and that you are doing greater works than you did at first.

20.verse: Nevertheless, I have this against you, that you tolerate that woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess and who by her teaching is luring my servants into acts of fornication and encouraging them to eat food that has been sacrificed to idols.

21.verse: “ ‘ “I have given her time to repent, but she refuses to repent of her fornication.

22.verse: So I will cast her onto a bed of pain, and all those who commit adultery with her will suffer intensely unless they renounce her practices.

23.verse: I will also strike her children dead. Thereby all the Churches will be shown that I am the one who searches minds and hearts and I will give to each of you what your works deserve.

24.verse: “ ‘ “And I say to the rest of you in Thyatira who have not accepted this teaching and who have no knowledge of what are designated as the deep secrets of Satan, I shall not impose any further burden on you,

25.verse: but hold firmly to what you have until I come.

26.verse: “ ‘ “To anyone who is victoriousand perseveres in doing my works until the end,I will give authority over the nations,

27.verse: the same authority that I received from my Father,to rule them with an iron rodand shatter them like clay pots.

28.verse: And to such a person I will also give the morning star.

29.verse: “ ‘ “Whoever has ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the Churches.” ’

1.verse: Chapter 3 -To Sardis. -“To the angel of the Church in Sardis, write:“ ‘These are the words of the one who has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars:“ ‘ “I know your deeds. You have a reputation for being alive, but you are dead.

2.verse: Be on guard and strengthen what remains and is at the point of death. For I have not found any of your deeds perfect in the sight of my God.

3.verse: Therefore, remember the teaching that you have received and heard. Hold on to it and repent. If you do not wake up, I will come like a thief, and you will never know at what hour I will come upon you.

4.verse: “ ‘ “However, there are still a few in Sardis who have not soiled their robes, and they will walk with me dressed in white, for they are worthy.

5.verse: Anyone who is victorious will be dressed like these in white robes, and I shall not blot his name from the book of life. Rather, I shall acknowledge it in the presence of my Father and his angels.

6.verse: “ ‘ “Whoever has ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the Churches.” ’

7.verse: To Philadelphia. -“To the angel of the Church in Philadelphia, write:“ ‘These are the words of the holy one,the true one,who has the key of David,who opens the door,and no one can shut it;who closes the door,and no one can open it:

8.verse: “ ‘ “I know your deeds. I have set before you an open door that no one will be able to close. I know that your strength is limited, yet you have kept my word and have not disowned my name.

9.verse: Behold, I will make those of the synagogue of Satan who claim to be Jews but are not, for they are lying—I will make them come and fall down at your feet and recognize that I have loved you.

10.verse: “ ‘ “Because you have kept my word to endure patiently, I will keep you safe during the time of trial that is going to come upon the whole world to put the inhabitants of the earth to the test.

11.verse: I am coming soon. Hold fast to what you already have so that no one may rob you of your crown.

12.verse: “ ‘ “Anyone who is victorious I will make into a pillar in the temple of my God, and never again will he depart from it. I will inscribe on him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which is coming down out of heaven from my God, as well as my own new name.

13.verse: “ ‘ “Whoever has ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the Churches.” ’

14.verse: To Laodicea. -“To the angel of the Church in Laodicea, write:“ ‘These are the words of the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the source of God’s creation:

15.verse: “ ‘ “I know your deeds, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were either hot or cold.

16.verse: As it is, since you are lukewarm, neither cold nor hot, I will spit you out of my mouth.

17.verse: For you say, ‘I am rich; I have prospered; I have everything I want,’ never realizing that you are wretched, pitiable, poor, blind, and naked.

18.verse: “ ‘ “I advise you to buy from me gold that has been refined by fire so that you will be truly rich, and white robes to clothe you so that you may keep the shame of your nakedness from being seen, and ointment to smear on your eyes so that you may see.

19.verse: I reprove and discipline all those whom I love. Therefore, be sincere in your desire to repent.

20.verse: “ ‘ “Behold, I am standing at the door, knocking. If one of you hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in and dine with that person and that person with me.

21.verse: To anyone who is victorious, I will give the right to sit with me on my throne, as I myself overcame and sat with my Father on his throne.

22.verse: “ ‘ “Whoever has ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the Churches.” ’ ”

1.verse: Celestial Visions about What Is To Come -Christ, Lord of History -Chapter 4 -Vision of the Throne. -Following this, I had a vision of heaven with an open door, and I heard the voice like a trumpet that I had heard speaking to me before, saying, “Come up here, and I will show you what must take place after this.”

2.verse: At once I was caught up in the spirit, and there in heaven I beheld a throne.

3.verse: Seated upon the throne was one whose appearance was similar to that of jasper and carnelian, and surrounding it was a rainbow that looked like an emerald.

4.verse: Encircling the throne were twenty-four thrones, and seated on them were twenty-four elders, dressed in white with gold crowns on their heads.

5.verse: Emanating from the throne were flashes of lightning and rumblings and peals of thunder. Burning in front of the throne were seven flaming lamps, the seven spirits of God,

6.verse: and in front of the throne there was something like a sea of glass as transparent as crystal.In the center of the throne and around it there were four living creatures, and they were covered with eyes in front and in back.

7.verse: The first living creature resembled a lion, the second resembled an ox, the third had a human face, and the fourth resembled an eagle in flight.

8.verse: Each of the four living creatures had six wings, and all of them were covered with eyes all around and underneath their wings. Day and night they never stop saying:“Holy, holy, holyis the Lord God, the Almighty,who was, and who is, and who is to come.”

9.verse: And whenever the living creatures give glory and honor and thanks to the one who sits on the throne, who lives forever and ever,

10.verse: the twenty-four elders prostrate themselves before him who is seated on the throne and worship the one who lives forever and ever. As they lay down their crowns in front of the throne, they cry out:

11.verse: “Worthy are you, O Lord our God,to receive glory and honor and power,for you created all things;by your will they were createdand have their being.”

1.verse: Chapter 5 -Vision of the Lamb. -Then I saw in the right hand of the one who was seated on the throne a scroll with writing on both sides and sealed with seven seals.

2.verse: And I beheld a mighty angel who proclaimed in a loud voice, “Who is worthy to open the scroll and break its seals?”

3.verse: But there was no one in heaven or on earth or under the earth who was able to open the scroll and examine it.

4.verse: I began to weep bitterly because no one was found worthy to open the scroll and examine it.

5.verse: Then one of the elders said to me, “Do not weep. The Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed, and thus has won the right to open the scroll and its seven seals.”

6.verse: Then I saw, standing in the center of the throne, encircled by the four living creatures and the elders, a Lamb that had been slain. He had seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven spirits of God sent forth into the entire world.

7.verse: He came forward and took the scroll from the right hand of the one who was seated on the throne.

8.verse: When he had taken the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders prostrated themselves before the Lamb. Each of the elders was holding a harp, and they had gold bowls filled with incense, which are the prayers of the saints.

9.verse: They sang a new song:“You are worthy to receive the scrolland to open its seals,for you were slain,and with your blood you purchased for Godpeople of every tribe and language, nation and race.

10.verse: You have made them to be a kingdom and priests to serve our God,and they will reign on earth.”

11.verse: In my vision, I heard the voices of a multitude of angels who surrounded the throne and the living creatures and the elders. These angels numbered thousands upon thousands and ten thousand times ten thousand of them.

12.verse: And they cried out with a loud voice:“Worthy is the Lamb that was sacrificedto receive power and riches, wisdom and strength,honor and glory and praise.”

13.verse: Then I heard every creature in heaven and on earth and under the earth and in the sea, and all that is in them, saying:“To the one seated on the throneand to the Lambbe blessing and honor and glory and mightforever and ever.”

14.verse: The four living creatures said, “Amen,” and the elders prostrated themselves in worship.

1.verse: Prelude to the End of Times: Israel and the Church -Chapter 6 -The First Four Seals and the Horsemen. -Then, in my vision, I saw the Lamb break open the first of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures shout in a voice like thunder, “Come!”

2.verse: I looked, and before my eyes I saw a white horse, and its rider was holding a bow. He was given a crown, and he rode forth as a victor to amass still further conquests.

3.verse: When he broke open the second seal, I heard the second living creature shout, “Come!”

4.verse: And another horse came forth; it was red. Its rider was empowered to take away peace from the earth so that people would slay each other. He was given a large sword.

5.verse: When he broke open the third seal, I heard the third living creature shout, “Come!” I looked, and there was a black horse, and its rider was holding a pair of scales in his hand.

6.verse: Then I heard what sounded like a voice emanating from the midst of the four living creatures, saying, “A quart of wheat costs a day’s wages, and three quarts of barley cost a day’s wages. But do not damage the olive oil or the wine.”

7.verse: When he broke open the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature shout, “Come!”

8.verse: I looked, and there was a pale green horse. Its rider was named Death, and Hades followed close behind. They were given authority over a fourth of the earth, to kill with sword, famine, and plague, and by means of wild beasts.

9.verse: The Fifth Seal: Vision of the Martyrs. -When he broke open the fifth seal, I saw underneath the altar the souls of those who had been slain on account of the word of God and for witnessing to it.

10.verse: They shouted in a loud voice, “How long is it to be, holy and true Master, before you judge the inhabitants of the earth and avenge our death?”

11.verse: Each of them was given a white robe, and they were instructed to be patient for a little longer until the roll was completed of their fellow servants and brethren who were still to be killed as they themselves had been.

12.verse: The Sixth Seal: the Universe Disturbed. -In my vision, when he broke open the sixth seal, there was a violent earthquake. The sun turned as black as coarse sackcloth, the moon became as red as blood,

13.verse: and the stars in the sky fell to earth like unripe figs dislodged from a tree when shaken by a strong wind.

14.verse: The heavens were torn apart like a scroll being rolled up, and every mountain and island was dislodged from its place.

15.verse: Then the kings of the earth, the nobles, and the commanders, the rich and the powerful, and the whole population, both slaves and free, hid themselves in caves and among the rocks of the mountains.

16.verse: They shouted to the mountains and the rocks, “Fall on us and hide us from the face of the one who sits on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb.

17.verse: For the great day of their wrath has come, and who can endure it?”

1.verse: Chapter 7 -An Immense Crowd before God’s Throne. -After this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds of the earth so that no wind could blow on land or on the sea or on any tree.

2.verse: Then I saw another angel rising from the east, bearing the seal of the living God. He cried out in a loud voice to the four angels who had been given the power to ravage the land and the sea,

3.verse: “Do not damage the land or the sea or the trees until we have set the seal on the foreheads of the servants of our God.”

4.verse: Then I heard how many had been marked with the seal—one hundred and forty-four thousand from all the tribes of Israel:

5.verse: From the tribe of Judah, twelve thousand,from the tribe of Reuben, twelve thousand,from the tribe of Gad, twelve thousand,

6.verse: from the tribe of Asher, twelve thousand,from the tribe of Naphtali, twelve thousand,from the tribe of Manasseh, twelve thousand,

7.verse: from the tribe of Simeon, twelve thousand,from the tribe of Levi, twelve thousand,from the tribe of Issachar, twelve thousand,

8.verse: from the tribe of Zebulun, twelve thousand,from the tribe of Joseph, twelve thousand,from the tribe of Benjamin, twelve thousand.

9.verse: After this, in my vision, I witnessed a vast throng that no one could count, from every nation, race, people, and language. They were standing before the throne and before the Lamb, dressed in white robes and holding palm branches in their hands.

10.verse: They cried out in a loud voice:“Salvation belongs to our God,who sits on the throne,and to the Lamb.”

11.verse: All the angels who were standing around the throne, and around the elders and the four living creatures, prostrated themselves before the throne and worshiped God,

12.verse: saying:“Amen. Praise and glory,wisdom and thanksgiving,honor and power and might,be to our God forever and ever. Amen.”

13.verse: Then one of the elders spoke to me and inquired, “Who are these people, all dressed in white robes, and where have they come from?”

14.verse: I replied, “My lord, you are the one who knows.” Then he said to me, “These are the ones who have survived the great tribulation. They have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

15.verse: “That is why they stand before the throne of Godand worship him day and night in his temple,and the one who sits on the throne will shelter them.

16.verse: They will never again experience hunger or thirst,nor will the sun or any scorching heat cause them discomfort.

17.verse: For the Lamb who is at the center of the thronewill be their shepherd.He will guide them to springs of living water,and God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.”

1.verse: Chapter 8 -The Seventh Seal. -When the Lamb broke open the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.

2.verse: And I saw that seven trumpets were given to the seven angels who stand in the presence of God.

3.verse: Another angel came forward with a gold censer and stood at the altar. He was given a large quantity of incense to offer, with the prayers of all the saints, on the gold altar that stood before the throne.

4.verse: The smoke of the incense together with the prayers of the saints rose before God from the hand of the angel.

5.verse: Then the angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and emptied it upon the earth. Immediately, there came peals of thunder, rumblings, flashes of lightning, and an earthquake.

6.verse: The seven angels who held the seven trumpets now made ready to blow them.

7.verse: The First Four Trumpets. -When the first angel blew his trumpet, there was a storm of hail and fire, mixed with blood, and it fell upon the earth. A third of the earth was burned up, as well as a third of the trees and all the green grass.

8.verse: When the second angel blew his trumpet, something that looked like a huge mountain ablaze with fire was hurled into the sea. A third of the sea turned into blood,

9.verse: a third of the creatures living in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.

10.verse: When the third angel blew his trumpet, a great star fell from the sky, burning like a torch. It came down on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water.

11.verse: This star was called “Wormwood,” and a third of the waters turned to wormwood. Great numbers of people died from the waters that had become bitter.

12.verse: When the fourth angel blew his trumpet, a third of the sun was struck, a third of the moon, and a third of the stars. As a result, a third of their light was darkened, and the day lost its illumination for a third of the time, and so did the night.

13.verse: The Cry of the Eagle. -In my vision, I heard an eagle cry out in a loud voice as it flew high overhead, “Woe! Woe! Woe to the inhabitants of the earth because of the other trumpet blasts that the three angels have not yet blown!”

1.verse: Chapter 9 -The Fifth Trumpet: the First Woe. -Then the fifth angel blew his trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen from the sky to the earth. He was given the key to the shaft leading down to the abyss.

2.verse: When he unlocked the shaft of the abyss, smoke rose up from the abyss like smoke from a huge furnace, so that the sun and the sky were darkened by the smoke from the abyss.

3.verse: And out of the smoke locusts dropped down onto the earth, and they were given the same powers that scorpions have on the earth.

4.verse: They were commanded not to damage the grass or the earth or any plant or tree, and they were told to attack only those people who did not have God’s seal on their foreheads.

5.verse: They were given permission to torture these people for five months, but they were not allowed to kill them, and the torment they were to inflict was to be like that of a scorpion when it stings someone.

6.verse: During that time, these people will seek death but will not find it; they will long to die, but death will elude them.

7.verse: In appearance the locusts were like horses equipped for battle. On their heads they wore what appeared to be gold crowns. Their faces were like human faces,

8.verse: and their hair was like women’s hair. Their teeth were like lions’ teeth,

9.verse: and their chests were like iron breastplates. The sound of their wings was like the rumble of many horses and chariots rushing into battle.

10.verse: These locusts had tails and stings like those of scorpions, and in their tails they had the power to torment people for five months.

11.verse: They had as their king the angel of the abyss, whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek, Apollyon.

12.verse: The first woe has passed, but two more are still to come.

13.verse: The Sixth Trumpet: the Second Woe. -Then the sixth angel blew his trumpet, and I heard a voice emanating from the horns of the gold altar that stood in the presence of God.

14.verse: It said to the sixth angel who was holding the trumpet, “Release the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates.”

15.verse: And so the four angels, who had been held in readiness for this very hour, day, month, and year, were released to kill a third of mankind.

16.verse: The number of their cavalry troops was two hundred million. This was the number I heard.

17.verse: This is how I saw the horses and their riders in my vision. The riders wore breastplates in shades of red, blue, and yellow. The heads of the horses were like heads of lions, and issuing forth from their mouths were fire, smoke, and sulfur.

18.verse: By these three plagues of fire, smoke, and sulfur that poured forth from their mouths, a third of mankind was killed.

19.verse: The power of the horses was in their mouths and in their tails. Their tails were like serpents, with heads that inflicted harm.

20.verse: However, the rest of mankind who survived these plagues did not repent of the work of their hands or cease their worship of demons and of idols of gold, silver, bronze, stone, and wood, which can neither see nor hear nor walk.

21.verse: Nor did they repent of their murders, their sorcery, their sexual immorality, or their thefts.

1.verse: Chapter 10 -A Small Scroll: Sweet and Bitter. -Then I saw another mighty angel coming down from heaven. He was wrapped in a cloud, with a rainbow over his head. His face was like the sun, his legs were like pillars of fire,

2.verse: and his hand held a small scroll that had been opened.Placing his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land,

3.verse: the angel gave forth a great shout like the roar of a lion. And when he shouted, the seven thunders spoke.

4.verse: After the seven thunders had spoken, I was preparing to write when I heard a voice from heaven say, “Seal up what the seven thunders have spoken, but do not write it down.”

5.verse: Then the angel whom I had seen standing on the sea and on the land raised his right hand to heaven

6.verse: and swore by him who lives forever and ever and who created heaven and earth and the sea and everything that is in them: “There will be no further delay.

7.verse: When the time comes for the seventh angel to sound his trumpet, the mysterious purpose of God will be fulfilled, just as he announced to his servants the Prophets.”

8.verse: Then I again heard the voice that had spoken to me from heaven, and it said, “Go and take that open scroll from the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the land.”

9.verse: Therefore, I went to the angel and asked him to give me the small scroll. He replied, “Take it and eat it. It will turn your stomach sour, but in your mouth it will taste as sweet as honey.”

10.verse: I took the small scroll from the angel’s hand and ate it. In my mouth it did taste as sweet as honey, but when I had eaten it my stomach turned sour.

11.verse: Then I was told, “You must prophesy once again about many peoples, nations, languages, and kings.”

1.verse: Chapter 11 -The Two Witnesses and the Fate of Jerusalem. -I was next given a staff to use as a measuring rod, and I was told, “Go forth and measure the temple of God and the altar, and count the people who are worshiping there.

2.verse: However, exclude the outer court of the temple from your measurements, because it has been handed over to the Gentiles and they will trample on the holy city for forty-two months.

3.verse: I will grant my two witnesses authority to prophesy for those twelve hundred and sixty days, wearing sackcloth.”

4.verse: These are the two olive trees and the two lampstands that stand in the presence of the Lord of the earth.

5.verse: If anyone tries to harm them, fire pours forth from their mouths and consumes their enemies. Anyone who attempts to harm them will surely be killed in this manner.

6.verse: They have the power to shut up the sky so that it does not rain during the time they are prophesying. They also have the power to turn water into blood and to afflict the earth with every type of plague as often as they desire.

7.verse: When they have completed their testimony, the beast that comes up from the abyss will wage war against them and overpower and kill them.

8.verse: Their corpses will lie in the street of the great city, known by the symbolic names of Sodom and Egypt, where their Lord was crucified.

9.verse: People of every race, tribe, nation, and language will gaze at their corpses for three and a half days and refuse to allow them to be buried.

10.verse: The inhabitants of the earth will gloat over them as they celebrate and exchange gifts, because these two prophets had been a source of torment to them.

11.verse: However, after the three and a half days, the breath of life from God entered them, and when they rose to their feet, great terror filled those who saw them.

12.verse: Then I heard a loud voice from heaven say to them, “Come up here,” and while their enemies were watching, they went up to heaven in a cloud.

13.verse: At that very hour there was a violent earthquake, and a tenth of the city was destroyed. Seven thousand people were killed during the earthquake. Those who survived were overcome with fear and gave glory to the God of heaven.

14.verse: The second woe has passed, but the third will come quickly.

15.verse: The Seventh Trumpet: the Third Woe. -The seventh angel blew his trumpet, and voices in heaven were heard crying loudly:“The kingdom of the world belongsto our Lord and his Messiah,and he will reign forever and ever.”

16.verse: Then the twenty-four elders who sit on their thrones in the presence of God prostrated themselves and worshiped God,

17.verse: saying:“We give you thanks, Lord God Almighty,who are and who were.For you have taken your great powerand have begun to reign.

18.verse: The nations rose in rage,but now your wrath has come.It is the time for judging the deadand for rewarding your servants the Prophets,as well as the saints who revere your name,both small and great,and for destroying those who destroy the earth.”

19.verse: Then God’s temple in heaven was opened, and the ark of his covenant was seen within his temple. There followed flashes of lightning, rumblings, peals of thunder, an earthquake, and a violent hailstorm.

1.verse: Chapter 12 -The Great Confrontation: Pagan Rome and the Church -Two Signs in Heaven: the Woman and the Dragon. -A great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon beneath her feet, and a crown of twelve stars on her head.

2.verse: She was with child and about to give birth, crying aloud in the anguish of her labor.

3.verse: Then another sign appeared in heaven: a huge red dragon with seven heads and ten horns, and seven diadems crowning his heads.

4.verse: His tail swept away a third of the stars in the sky and hurled them to the earth.The dragon stood in front of the woman who was about to give birth, so that it might devour her child as soon as it was born.

5.verse: She gave birth to a son, a male child who is destined to rule all the nations with an iron rod. And her child was taken up directly to God and to his throne.

6.verse: The woman herself fled into the wilderness where she would be looked after for twelve hundred and sixty days in a place prepared for her by God.

7.verse: Next, war broke out in heaven, with Michael and his angels in combat against the dragon. The dragon and his angels fought back,

8.verse: but they were defeated, and they lost their place in heaven.

9.verse: The great dragon—the ancient serpent who is called the devil, or Satan, the deceiver of the whole world—was hurled down to earth, and his angels were cast down with him.

10.verse: Then I heard a loud voice in heaven say:“Now have come the salvation and the powerand the kingdom of our Godand the authority of his Messiah.For the accuser of our brethren has been cast out,the one who accused them day and night before our God.

11.verse: They have conquered himby the blood of the Lamband by the word of their testimony;even in the face of deaththey did not cling to life.

12.verse: Therefore rejoice, you heavens,and you who dwell in them!But woe to you, earth and sea,because the devil has come down to you.He is filled with rage,for he knows that his time is short.”

13.verse: When the dragon realized that he had been hurled down to earth, he pursued the woman who had given birth to the male child.

14.verse: But the woman was given the two wings of the great eagle so that she could fly away from the serpent into the wilderness, to the place where she was to be looked after for a year, two years, and a half year.

15.verse: Then from his mouth the serpent spewed out water like a river after the woman to sweep her away with the flood.

16.verse: However, the earth came to the rescue of the woman: it opened its mouth and swallowed the river spewed from the dragon’s mouth.

17.verse: Then the dragon became enraged at the woman and went off to wage war on the rest of her offspring, those who keep God’s commandments and bear witness to Jesus.

1.verse: Chapter 13 -Then I saw a beast rising out of the sea. It had ten horns and seven heads. On its horns were ten diadems, and on its heads were blasphemous names.

2.verse: The beast that I saw resembled a leopard, but it had feet like those of a bear, and its mouth was like the mouth of a lion. The dragon conferred on the beast his own power and his throne, as well as great authority.

3.verse: One of his heads appeared to me to have been mortally wounded, but its mortal wound had been healed. The whole world then became fascinated with the beast,

4.verse: and they worshiped the dragon because he had conferred authority on the beast. They also worshiped the beast, saying, “Who can compare with the beast? Who can fight against it?”

5.verse: It was allowed to mouth its haughty and blasphemous words, and it was granted permission to exercise its authority for forty-two months.

6.verse: It opened its mouth to utter blasphemies against God, as well as against his name and his dwelling and all those who live in heaven.

7.verse: The beast was also allowed to wage war on the saints and conquer them, and it was given authority over every tribe, people, language, and nation.

8.verse: All the inhabitants of the earth will worship it, all those whose names have not been written from the creation of the world in the book of life belonging to the Lamb who was slain.

9.verse: Whoever has ears should listen to these words:

10.verse: “If anyone is to go into captivity,into captivity he will go.If anyone is destined to be slain by the sword,by the sword he must be slain.”This demands patient endurance and faithfulness on the part of the saints.

11.verse: A Beast Rises from the Earth. -Then I saw another beast, this one rising up out of the earth. It had two horns like those of a lamb, but it spoke like a dragon.

12.verse: It wielded all the authority of the first beast on its behalf, and it forced the earth and all its inhabitants to worship the first beast, whose mortal wound had been healed.

13.verse: It performed great signs, even making fire come down from heaven to earth in the sight of all.

14.verse: By the signs it was allowed to perform on behalf of the beast, it deceived the inhabitants of the earth, persuading them to erect an image for the beast that had been wounded by the sword and yet lived.

15.verse: It was permitted to give life to the beast’s image so that it could even speak and cause all those to be put to death who would not worship the image of the beast.

16.verse: It also forced all the people, both small and great, both rich and poor, both free and slave, to be branded on the right hand or on the forehead.

17.verse: No one could buy or sell anything except one who has been branded with the name of the beast or with the number of its name.

18.verse: There is wisdom here. Let anyone who has understanding calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a person. The number is six hundred and sixty-six.

1.verse: Chapter 14 -The Song of the Martyrs. -Next in my vision, I saw the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him were one hundred and forty-four thousand people who had his name and his Father’s name written on their foreheads.

2.verse: I heard a sound from heaven like that of a mighty torrent or a loud peal of thunder. It was like the sound of harpists playing their harps.

3.verse: They were singing a new song before the throne and before the four living creatures and the elders. No one could learn this song except the one hundred and forty-four thousand who had been redeemed from the earth.

4.verse: These are the ones who have not defiled themselves with women. They are virgins, and they follow the Lamb wherever he goes. They have been redeemed as the firstfruits of mankind for God and for the Lamb.

5.verse: No lie was found on their lips. They are irreproachable.

6.verse: The Nearness of the Judgment. -Then I saw another angel flying in midair, with an eternal gospel to proclaim to all those who live on the earth, to every nation, race, language, and people.

7.verse: He said in a loud voice, “Fear God and give him glory, for the time has come for his judgment. Worship him who made heaven and earth, the sea and the springs of water.”

8.verse: A second angel followed him, saying:“Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great.She has made all the nations drinkthe wine of the wrath of her immorality.”

9.verse: A third angel followed them, crying out in a loud voice, “Anyone who worships the beast or its image and receives its mark on his forehead or hand

10.verse: will also drink the wine of God’s wrath, poured undiluted into the cup of his wrath. Such people will be tormented in burning sulfur in the presence of the holy angels and of the Lamb.

11.verse: The smoke of their torment will rise forever and ever. There will be no respite day or night for those who worship the beast or its image or for those who receive the mark of its name.”

12.verse: This demands patient endurance on the part of the saints who keep the commandments of God and remain faithful to Jesus.

13.verse: Then I heard a voice from heaven say, “Write: Blessed are those who die in the Lord from now on.”“Yes,” says the Spirit, “they will find rest from their labors, for their deeds go with them.”

14.verse: One Like a Son of Man. -Now in my vision, I saw a white cloud, and seated on the cloud was one “like a son of man,” with a gold crown on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand.

15.verse: Another angel then came out of the temple and called out in a loud voice to the one seated on the cloud, “Use your sickle and reap, for the time to reap has come, because the harvest of the earth is fully ripe.”

16.verse: So the one who was seated on the cloud swept over the earth with his sickle, and the earth was harvested.

17.verse: Another angel came out of the temple in heaven, and he, too, had a sharp sickle.

18.verse: Then from the altar came forth still another angel who was in charge of the fire, and he cried out in a loud voice to the one who had the sharp sickle, “Take your sharp sickle and gather the clusters from the vines of the earth, for her grapes are ripe.”

19.verse: So the angel swung his sickle over the earth and gathered in its vintage, which he then cast into the great winepress of God’s wrath.

20.verse: The winepress was trodden outside the city, and blood flowed from the winepress to the height of a horse’s bridle for a distance of two hundred miles.

1.verse: Chapter 15 -The Seven Angels and the Seven Plagues. -Then I saw in heaven another great and wondrous sign: seven angels with the seven plagues, the last plagues of all, for through them the wrath of God is completed.

2.verse: The Song of Moses and the Song of the Lamb. -I saw something that looked like a sea of glass mixed with fire. Standing beside the sea of glass and holding the harps that God had given them were those who had been victorious over the beast and its image and over the number of its name. They were holding harps given them by God

3.verse: and singing the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb:“How great and wonderful are your works,Lord God Almighty!Just and true are your ways,O King of the nations!

4.verse: Who shall not fear you, O Lord,and bring glory to your name?For you alone are holy.All nations will comeand worship before you,for your acts of justice have been revealed.”

5.verse: The Justice and Triumph of God -Vision of the Temple. -After this, in my vision, the temple, that is, the tabernacle of the Testimony, was opened in heaven,

6.verse: and from the temple emerged the seven angels with the seven plagues. They were robed in clean, shining linen, and breastplates of gold were fastened around their chests.

7.verse: Then one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven gold bowls full of the wrath of God, who lives forever and ever.

8.verse: The temple was filled with the smoke from the glory of God and from his power, so that no one could enter the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels were completed.

1.verse: Chapter 16 -The Seven Bowls of the Wrath of God. -Then I heard a loud voice from the temple say to the seven angels, “Go forth and pour out on the earth the seven bowls of the wrath of God.”

2.verse: The first angel went forth and poured out his bowl on the earth. Immediately, foul and malignant sores broke out on those who had the mark of the beast and who worshiped its image.

3.verse: The second angel poured out his bowl on the sea. It turned to blood, like the blood of a dead person, and every living thing in the sea died.

4.verse: The third angel poured out his bowl on the rivers and the springs of water, and they turned to blood.

5.verse: Then I heard the angel in charge of the waters say:“You are just, O Holy One,who are and who were,in these your judgments.

6.verse: For they have shed the bloodof the saints and the Prophets,and you have given them blood to drink,as they deserve.”

7.verse: And I heard the altar respond:“Yes, Lord God Almighty,true and just are your judgments.”

8.verse: The fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun, and the sun was allowed to burn people with its flames.

9.verse: They were scorched by the fierce heat, and they cursed the name of God who had the power to inflict those plagues, but they refused to repent and pay him homage.

10.verse: The fifth angel poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast, and its kingdom was plunged into darkness. People gnawed their tongues in agony

11.verse: and cursed the God of heaven because of their pains and sores, instead of repenting for what they had done.

12.verse: The sixth angel poured out his bowl on the great river Euphrates, and its water was dried up to prepare the way for the kings from the East.

13.verse: I saw three unclean spirits like frogs come forth from the mouth of the dragon, from the mouth of the beast, and from the mouth of the false prophet.

14.verse: These are demonic spirits with the power to work miracles. They were sent to the kings of the entire world to assemble them for battle on the great day of God the Almighty.

15.verse: “Behold, I am coming like a thief! Blessed is the one who stays awake and keeps his clothes close by so that he will not have to go naked and be exposed to shame.”

16.verse: These spirits then assembled the kings at the place that in Hebrew is called Armageddon.

17.verse: The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and a loud voice came out of the temple from the throne, saying, “It is done!”

18.verse: Then there followed flashes of lightning, rumblings, peals of thunder, and a violent earthquake—so violent that there has never been one like it since the human race has inhabited the earth.

19.verse: The great city was split into three parts, and the cities of the nations collapsed in ruin. Babylon the Great was also remembered by God, as he made her drink the cup filled with the wine of his fury and wrath.

20.verse: Every island vanished, and no mountains were to be found.

21.verse: Huge hailstones, each weighing about one hundred pounds, fell from the sky on the people, and they cursed God on account of the plague of hail that turned out to be so terrible.

1.verse: Chapter 17 -Babylon the Great, the Infamous Harlot. -One of the seven angels who held the seven bowls approached me and said, “Come here and I will show you the judgment on the great harlot who is enthroned over many waters.

2.verse: The kings of the earth have committed fornication with her, and the inhabitants of the earth have become drunk on the wine of her harlotry.”

3.verse: Then he carried me away in the spirit into the wilderness, and I saw a woman seated on a scarlet beast that had seven heads and ten horns and was covered with blasphemous names.

4.verse: The woman was clothed in purple and scarlet and adorned with gold and jewels and pearls. In her hand she held a gold cup filled with accursed things and the impurities of her harlotry.

5.verse: On her forehead was written a mysterious name: “Babylon the Great, the mother of harlots and of every abomination on the earth.”

6.verse: And I noticed that the woman was drunk with the blood of the saints and the blood of those who had borne witness to Jesus.When I saw her, I was utterly astounded.

7.verse: But the angel said to me, “Why are you astounded? I will explain to you the mystery of the woman and of the beast with the seven heads and the ten horns that carries her.

8.verse: The beast that you saw was once alive but is now alive no longer. It is about to ascend from the abyss and go to its destruction. All the inhabitants of the earth whose names have not been written in the book of life since the foundation of the world will be astonished when they see the beast, because it was once alive but is now alive no longer, and yet it is still to come.

9.verse: “This calls for a mind with wisdom. The seven heads represent seven hills upon which the woman is seated. They also represent seven kings.

10.verse: Five have already fallen, one is still living, and the other has not yet come. When he does come, he must remain only for a short while.

11.verse: As for the beast that was alive but is now alive no longer, it is at the same time the eighth and one of the seven, and it is headed for destruction.

12.verse: “The ten horns that you saw are ten kings who have not yet begun to reign. They will have royal authority for only a single hour together with the beast.

13.verse: They are all of the same mind and will confer their power and authority on the beast.

14.verse: They will wage war against the Lamb, but because the Lamb is Lord of lords and King of kings, he will overcome them—he and those who are with him, the called, the chosen, and the faithful.”

15.verse: The angel continued, “The waters that you saw, where the harlot sits, represent peoples, multitudes, nations, and languages.

16.verse: The ten horns that you saw and the beast will hate the harlot. They will render her desolate and naked; after they devour her flesh, they will burn her up with fire.

17.verse: “For God has influenced their hearts to carry out his purpose by agreeing to confer their royal powers upon the beast until the words of God will be fulfilled.

18.verse: The woman you saw is the great city that has authority over the kings of the earth.”

1.verse: Chapter 18 -The Fall of Babylon the Great. -After this I saw another angel coming down from heaven. He had great authority, and his splendor illumined the earth.

2.verse: He cried out in a mighty voice:“Fallen, fallen is Babylon the Great!She has become a dwelling place for demons,a haunt for every unclean spiritand for every filthy and loathsome bird.

3.verse: For all the nations have drunkthe wine of the wrath of her harlotry.The kings of the earth have committed fornication with her,and the merchants of the earth have grown richfrom her wealth and luxury.”

4.verse: Then I heard another voice from heaven saying:“Depart from her, my people,so that you will not take part in her sinsand share in her plagues.

5.verse: For her sins are piled up as high as the heavens,and God has remembered her crimes.

6.verse: Pay her back as she has done to others,and repay her double for her deeds;mix her a double portion of her own poison.

7.verse: Give her torment and griefto equal the measure of her glory and luxury.In her heart she says,‘I rule as a queen.I am not a widow,and I will never experience grief.’

8.verse: Therefore, in a single dayher plagues will come upon her:pestilence and mourning and famine.And she will be consumed by fire,for mighty is the Lord God who judges her.

9.verse: Funereal Ode over Rome. -“The kings of the earth who committed fornication with her and shared in her luxury will weep and mourn over her when they behold the smoke of her immolation.

10.verse: In terror at her torment, they will keep their distance and say:“ ‘Woe, woe, O great city,mighty city of Babylon.In one hour your judgment has come.’

11.verse: “The merchants of the earth will weep and mourn over her, since no one buys their cargo anymore:

12.verse: their cargo of gold, silver, precious stones, and pearls; purple and scarlet cloth, silks, and fine linens; all sorts of fragrant wood and all kinds of objects of ivory, all kinds of objects of expensive wood, bronze, iron, and marble;

13.verse: cinnamon and spices; incense, myrrh, and frankincense; wine and olive oil; fine flour and wheat; cattle and sheep; horses and chariots; and slaves, that is, human lives. They will say:

14.verse: “ ‘The fruit you longed foris no longer available to you.All your riches and splendor are gone,and you will never find them again.’

15.verse: “The merchants of these things who made a fortune from her will stand far off, weeping and mourning aloud, and terrified as they behold her torment:

16.verse: “ ‘Woe, woe, O great city,clothed in fine linen and purple and scarlet,adorned with gold, jewels, and precious stones!

17.verse: Within one hourall this wealth has been destroyed.’“All the ship captains and voyagers, all the sailors and those who make their living by trading upon the sea, will stand far off

18.verse: and exclaim as they see the smoke caused by her immolation, ‘Has there ever been a city to compare with this great city?’

19.verse: Then they will throw dust on their heads and with mourning and weeping cry out:“ ‘Woe, woe, O great city,where all who had ships at seabecame rich through her wealth!Within one hourshe has been brought to ruin.

20.verse: Rejoice over her, O heaven,you holy ones, apostles, and prophets!For God has passed judgment on her for you.’ ”

21.verse: Then a mighty angel picked up a stone the size of a large millstone and threw it into the sea, saying:“This is howthe great city of Babylon will be thrown down,never to be found again.

22.verse: The sound of harpists and minstrels,flute players and trumpeters,will never be heard in you again.Craftsmen of every tradenever will be found in you again.The sound of a millstonewill never be heard in you again.

23.verse: The light from a lampwill never be seen in you again.The voices of a bridegroom and bridewill never be heard in you again.Since your merchants were the world’s great men,all the nations were led astray by your enticements.

24.verse: In you was found the blood of the Prophets,of the saints,and of all who have been slain on the earth.”

1.verse: Chapter 19 -Song of Victory and Wedding Day of the Lamb. -After this I heard what sounded like the roar of a great multitude in heaven, shouting:“Alleluia!Salvation and glory and power belong to our God,

2.verse: for true and just are his judgments.He has condemned the great harlotwho corrupted the earth with her harlotry.And he has paid her backfor the blood of his servants.”

3.verse: Once again they shouted:“Alleluia!Her smoke will riseforever and ever.”

4.verse: The twenty-four elders and the four living creatures threw themselves to the ground and worshiped God who was seated on the throne, and they cried:“Amen. Alleluia!”

5.verse: Then a voice came from the throne, saying:“Praise our God,all you his servants,and all who fear him,small and great alike.”

6.verse: And I heard what seemed to be the sound of a vast multitude, like the sound of a torrential stream or of great peals of thunder, crying out:“Alleluia.The reign of the Lord our God,the Almighty, has begun.

7.verse: Let us rejoice and be gladand give him glory.For the wedding day of the Lamb has come,and the bride has made herself ready.

8.verse: She has been permitted to weara bright and clean garment of fine linen.”(The fine linen represents the righteous deeds of the saints.)

9.verse: Then the angel said to me, “Write: ‘Blessed are those who are invited to the wedding banquet of the Lamb.’ ” And he added, “These are the true words of God.”

10.verse: I fell at his feet to worship him, but he said to me, “You must not do that! I am a fellow servant with you and with your brethren who have given witness to Jesus. Worship God! For the witness to Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.

11.verse: Recapitulative Visions of the History of Salvation -The White Horse and the King of Kings. -Now I saw heaven opened, and a white horse appeared. Its rider was called “Faithful and True,” for with righteousness he judges and wages war.

12.verse: His eyes were like fiery flames, and on his head were many crowns. The name inscribed on him was known to no one but himself.

13.verse: He was clothed in a robe dipped in blood, and he was known by the name The Word of God.

14.verse: The armies of heaven were following him, riding on white horses and dressed in fine linen, white and clean.

15.verse: Coming out of his mouth was a sharp sword with which to strike down the nations. He will rule them with an iron scepter, and he will tread the winepress of the fury of the wrath of God the Almighty.

16.verse: On his robe and on his thigh he had a name inscribed: “King of kings and Lord of lords.”

17.verse: The Great Booty. -Then I saw an angel standing in the sun, and with a loud voice he cried out to all the birds flying in midair, “Come here! Gather together for the great supper of God,

18.verse: to eat the flesh of kings, the flesh of commanders, and the flesh of warriors, the flesh of horses and their riders, the flesh of all, both free and slave, both small and great.”

19.verse: The Beast and the False Prophet. -Next I saw the beast and the kings of the earth and their armies gathered together to wage war against the one upon the horse and against his army.

20.verse: The beast was captured, and with it the false prophet who in its presence had performed the signs by which he had deluded those who had received the mark of the beast and those who had worshiped its image.These two were thrown alive into the fiery lake of burning sulfur.

21.verse: The rest were killed by the sword that came forth from the mouth of the rider on the horse, and all the birds gorged themselves on their flesh.

1.verse: Chapter 20 -The Dragon. -Then I saw an angel coming down from heaven, with the key to the abyss and a great chain in his hand.

2.verse: He seized the dragon, that ancient serpent, who is the devil, or Satan, and chained him up for a thousand years.

3.verse: He threw him into the abyss and locked and sealed it over him, so that he would not again deceive the nations until the thousand years were ended. After that he must be released, but only for a short time.

4.verse: The Reign of the Martyrs: Return and Destruction of Satan. -Next, I saw thrones on which were seated those who had been given the authority to judge. I also saw the souls of those who had been beheaded for bearing witness to Jesus and the word of God. They had not worshiped the beast or its image and had not received its mark on their foreheads or their hands. They lived and reigned with Christ for a thousand years.

5.verse: The rest of the dead did not come to life until the thousand years were ended. This is the first resurrection.

6.verse: Blessed and holy are those who share in the first resurrection. The second death has no power over them. They will be priests of God and of Christ, and they will reign with him for a thousand years.

7.verse: When the thousand years are ended, Satan will be released from his prison

8.verse: and will emerge to lead astray the nations in the four corners of the earth—Gog and Magog—in order to gather them for battle. They are as numerous as the sands of the sea.

9.verse: They marched across the breadth of the earth and laid siege to the camp of the saints and the beloved city. However, fire came down from heaven and devoured them.

10.verse: The devil who had led them astray was thrown into the fiery lake of burning sulfur, where the beast and the false prophet had been flung to be tormented day and night forever and ever.

11.verse: Preparation for the Judgment. -Then I saw a great white throne, and the one who was seated upon it. The earth and the sky fled so far from his presence that they could no longer be found.

12.verse: The Resurrection and Judgment. -And I saw the dead, great and small, standing before the throne, and the scrolls were opened. Then another scroll was opened, the book of life, and the dead were judged according to their deeds, as were recorded in the scrolls.

13.verse: The sea gave up all the dead who were in it, and Death and Hades gave up the dead that were in them. The dead were judged according to their deeds.

14.verse: Then Death and Hades were hurled into the fiery lake. This fiery lake is the second death.

15.verse: Anyone who was not found written in the book of life was thrown into the fiery lake.

1.verse: The New Jerusalem A New World and a New People -Chapter 21 -The New Heaven and the New Earth. -Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth. For the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and there was no longer any sea.

2.verse: And I saw the holy city, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, like a bride adorned and ready for her husband.

3.verse: And I heard a loud voice proclaim from the throne:“Behold, God’s dwelling is with mankind;he will dwell with them.They will be his people,and he will be their God,God-with-them.

4.verse: He will wipe every tear from their eyes,and there will no longer be death.Neither will there be any mourning or crying or pain,for the old order has passed away.”

5.verse: The one seated on the throne then said, “Behold, I am making all things new.” He also said, “Write this down, for these words are trustworthy and true.”

6.verse: Then he said to me, “It is done. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. To those who are thirsty I will give to drink without cost from the spring of life-giving water.

7.verse: “The one who is victorious will inherit these things, and I will be his God and he will be my son.

8.verse: But as for the cowardly, the faithless, the depraved, the murderers, the sexually immoral, the sorcerers, the idolaters, and liars of every kind, their place is the fiery lake of burning sulfur, which is the second death.”

9.verse: The New Jerusalem. -One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls filled with the seven final plagues came forward and said to me, “Come, and I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb.”

10.verse: Then he carried me away in the spirit to the top of a very high mountain and showed me the holy city Jerusalem coming down out of heaven from God.

11.verse: It possessed the glory of God and had the radiance of some priceless jewel, like jasper, clear as crystal.

12.verse: Its wall was of a great height, with twelve gates, and at the gates there were twelve angels. On the gates were written the names of the twelve tribes of Israel.

13.verse: There were three gates to the east, three to the north, three to the south, and three to the west.

14.verse: The city wall had twelve foundation stones, and on them were the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.

15.verse: The angel who was speaking to me was carrying a gold measuring rod to measure the city, its gates, and its wall.

16.verse: The city was laid out like a square, with its length and its width identical. He measured the city with his measuring rod: it was fifteen hundred miles in length and width, and equal in height.

17.verse: Then he measured its wall, and it was one hundred and forty-four cubits high by human measurements, which the angel employed.

18.verse: The wall was built of jasper, while the city itself was of pure gold, as bright as clear glass.

19.verse: The foundations of the city wall were adorned with precious stones of every kind. The first of the foundation stones was jasper, the second sapphire, the third turquoise, the fourth emerald,

20.verse: the fifth onyx, the sixth carnelian, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh jacinth, and the twelfth amethyst.

21.verse: The twelve gates were twelve pearls, each of the gates fashioned from a single pearl, and the street of the city was pure gold, like transparent glass.

22.verse: I did not see any temple there, for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.

23.verse: And the city had no need for the sun or the moon to shine on it, for it was lit by the glory of God, and its lamp was the Lamb.

24.verse: The nations will walk by its light, and to it the kings of the earth will bring their treasures.

25.verse: The gates of the city will never be shut during the day—and there will be no night there.

26.verse: The nations will come into it bringing their treasures and wealth.

27.verse: However, nothing unclean will ever enter it, nor will anyone who does abominable or deceitful things, but only those who are written in the Lamb’s book of life.

1.verse: Chapter 22 -Then the angel showed me the river of the water of life, bright as crystal, flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb

2.verse: down the middle of the street. On either side of the river was the tree of life with its twelve crops of fruit, yielding fruit each month. The leaves of the trees are for the healing of the nations.

3.verse: Nothing accursed will be found there anymore. The throne of God and of the Lamb will be in it, and his servants will worship him.

4.verse: They will see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads.

5.verse: And there will be no more night. They will have no need for light from a lamp or from the sun, for the Lord God will give them light, and they will reign forever and ever.

6.verse: Epilogue: My Return Is Near -Worship God Alone. -The angel said to me, “These words are trustworthy and true, for the Lord God who inspires the prophets has sent his angel to show his servants what soon must take place.

7.verse: “ ‘Behold, I am coming soon!’ Blessed is the one who observes the words of prophecy contained in this book.”

8.verse: I, John, am the one who heard and saw these things. And when I had heard and seen them, I knelt at the feet of the angel who had shown them to me to worship him.

9.verse: However, he said to me, “You must not do that. I am a fellow servant of you and of your brethren the prophets and of those who observe the words of this book. Worship God!”

10.verse: The Great Separation. -Then he said to me, “Do not seal up the words of prophecy that are in this book, for the time is near.

11.verse: Let the wicked persist in acting wickedly, and let the vile continue in their vileness, but let the righteous persevere in righteousness, and let the holy continue to be holy.”

12.verse: “ ‘Behold, I am coming soon, and I will bring with me my reward to repay everyone as his deeds deserve.

13.verse: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End.’

14.verse: “Blessed are those who wash their robes clean so that they will be free to eat from the tree of life and may enter the city by the gates.

15.verse: Others must remain outside: the dogs, the sorcerers, the sexually immoral, the murderers, the idolaters, and everyone who loves and practices deceit.

16.verse: “Come, Lord Jesus!” -“ ‘I, Jesus, sent my angel to you with this testimony for the churches. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, the bright Morning Star.’ ”

17.verse: The Spirit and the bride say, “Come!” Let each listener say, “Come!” Let everyone who thirsts come forward, and let the one who desires it receive the gift of life-giving water.

18.verse: I warn everyone who hears the words of prophecy in this book: if anyone adds to them, God will add to him the plagues written about in this book;

19.verse: if anyone takes away from the words in this book of prophecy, God will take away his share in the tree of life and in the holy city, which are written about in this book.

20.verse: The one who gives this testimony says, “Yes, I am coming soon.”Amen. Come, Lord Jesus!

21.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you all.
